317DA696082A4C29B62611C8091C2276.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

0B898EF88D86417F8F1C29F5024AEA43.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

120B892029E649B8845E21FE6073A96B.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

BC7E4E259B3A493792E1A20380F22CFE.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

674B855E0FD747F0AC8BE18964CF8C06.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry

8C8A77DDF6B042699A5F38F3FA7A9186.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

8056031B83DB4288A5009E7F0E1A9910.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

0C4636371E8A4A9CAC422697774B37CF.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability

9250F5F76DFE48D7B044E613FD31175C.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

F7864EF5CF8048C4B63B9A95339D8808.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

DE6F3BFE0D0045F48D7983AB9D7AAE99.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

6228FD3A53E849A7B2B65924F9732204.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

91CD6225B8DD4FDD83AABA771B1019BC.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

69B3B652E10C4635863AC0D5E21BE072.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours? Who is my supervisor? What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement? Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits an,d emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear?, Is it provided?What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace? How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

0A645BD58DB14C049EDA7426EA21C5F6.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

0FACEDF79D7B41178CD37844A848DBEB.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

84AC3FCFBA634D9CB3E3B8532B70A857.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

48FC88A0A10B49C6AB4B8F0E956B8707.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

DAEAE529D74344F2A2734DC076ADE05E.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

D65528FE1FA344F9AEDBCE82B32748FC.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

B47CB4A01078491C996FEAE5E8ADBD95.description: Explore the use of policy and its effect on food security/insecurity locally, provincially and nationally.

2D05181BB5304E4F90B3745299C2B80E.description: Investigate what supports are available for Saskatchewan schools to create, update and implement food policies.

375FF2FCFDCD42D086612C9F24280CAB.description: Research school or division food policies.

E17FA7F98DF14DE8894EA0EE8D3EBC1D.description: Examine the importance of food policies.

055E4E9725C040439925470FF2D39983.description: Inquire into local regulations and guidelines for home-based food businesses such as catering, food trucks, meal delivery, food kits and food market vendors.

E714D0E8636F4CB7B17CD832CF7BB5FF.description: Examine opportunities and challenges faced by First Nations and Métis people in Canada in relation to Treaty and land-use rights and selfgovernance of food policy

9C80CB46363248BA91D3214F75A82481.description: Predict how current and future trends in food and nutrition could impact legislation, regulations and policies.

487290BA4FE54B96A33DF85A9CD14C81.description: Describe how food promotion and marketing strategies are influenced by legislation, regulations and policies.

DD164CE003FF42E1B6BFAD511154EA98.description: Analyze the roles and responsibilities of Canadian government agencies and food companies in food labelling (e.g., regulations, nutrition facts, health claims, terminology, ingredients, calories, allergies, preservatives).

F84C892AF2434A75B1E3F53982FE4464.description: Explore perspectives and land-use policies that influence the growing, gathering, hunting and harvesting of food, including numbered Treaties and Métis hunting and fishing rights (e.g., Morin and Daigneault decision).

AC4FF2B9E7274062A4B22BB0DAFF227D.description: Identify information (e.g., food guides, school nutrition guidelines, advisory councils) used to develop regional and/or national food policies.

FDB317D418894B4EA7C8B3E96178093F.description: Examine legislation, regulations and agencies that influence food policy in Canada.

7831464B9A474F098F56FF120054CA63.description: Investigate the psychology of shopping for/purchasing food (e.g., product placement in stores, setup of aisles, ambiance).

9DAD12AAA3E84EFCA675AA2B42395DFB.description: Reflect on one meal eaten recently and consider the factors that went into those food choices (e.g., cost, convenience, advertising).

514A08A070C4456BB8ACF9E1BBB56922.description: Reflect on one meal eaten recently and consider the factors that went into those food choices (e.g., cost, convenience, advertising).

DACB6313692B4A76826900CA3616058D.description: Examine the influences of various social situations (e.g., celebration, comfort, sympathy, affection) on foods consumed

FB378278035642F6963D9250E00E046C.description: Investigate how specific factors can influence food choices and eating habits including: lifestyle; religion/spirituality; culture; personal history; region and geography; social needs (e.g., peers, status); physical needs; emotional needs; economic capacity; advertising and social media; where food is consumed (e.g., table, desk, couch); special occasions; food availability; taste; convenience; how food was grown (e.g., fair trade, organic, animal welfare); nutrition; and, trends and fads.

53FB83F275AD44358F0DF249F124A81C.description: Discuss the meaning of food psychology and mindful eating

3C3B15B62EA241768511AA9978D5D1B7.description: Prepare or describe the process of preparing recipes that use locally grown or sourced foods.

F65F277AB6C344BCB87B83FF85037B59.description: Investigate how food is disposed of in Saskatchewan (e.g., landfill, commercial and home composting, animal feed).

055682E2391C448C8408449890A8D8AC.description: Examine different types of farming in Saskatchewan including: small scale; homesteading; urban; dairy; cattle; organic; and, conventional.

4D8B7F7E66E64F7C8BC6AC22C21B7371.description: Explain what fair trade is with respect to food.

111C571621234D7BBAC95494D0EC0EE9.description: Examine the challenges and benefits of relying on foods produced locally.

B28A114E4F264FC2B07ECDDC309388E3.description: Investigate Saskatchewan produced foods and food products that are exported globally.

E5A1DEC1B4194A948A1A8AE7D98B5FF5.description: Investigate the economic impact that First Nations and Métis have on the provincial and territorial economies and the resulting benefits for all people (e.g. hunting, fishing and gathering).

9C39FF493387449883BC3B33BB58DFB3.description: Examine the contemporary economic implications of Indigenous food production and its relationship to the Treaties in Saskatchewan.

3A7600D2DEC54DFD8825DA25B48D0348.description: Explore historical, urban, rural, traditional Indigenous, on-reserve and northern costs of food.

1DEF725DDCAA4A17B10683707EDC619E.description: Discuss agriculture in Saskatchewan and its links with food production and consumption.

06D75533C8EE40E9B939454FA8633BA0.description: Inquire into food production and consumption patterns in Saskatchewan

1AB05E8E25FE409EB3CCBFB42624FABE.description: Analyze individual consumer responsibilities regarding food choices such as: human rights (e.g., fair trade); food sustainability; food waste; and, environmental impact.

41ACEF7F042C4E448071909ED475A0D5.description: Assess the interrelationship of countries regarding food production and consumption.

5FEA0053ABE440C483714FB4068397B0.description: Explore all aspects of the food system in Saskatchewan including: where food comes from; who produces food; how food is produced; how food is processed; how food is marketed and sold; how food is purchased and consumed; and, how food is disposed of.

7CA7A30ACC5941C39F22540D27B7600F.description: Invite a community member to discuss foods and related stories that are unique to their culture.

BB1956744595432AB6D9FA9D7250D087.description: Explore Canadian adaptations to a variety of international dishes.

202B6A3D81B3407C9B93BFBEEB033E5B.description: Investigate foods from a variety of cultures found in the local community considering elements such as: cooking methods; nutritive value; ingredients; preparation time; and, how it fits into Canada’s Food Guide.

84032A966F1C4FBD9A08E99DEAC6B8EB.description: Examine reasons (e.g., accessibility, availability, nutrition value, cost, ease of storage) why some foods in various cultures are considered staple foods.

1B2B479A90404B8BBC49DAC141685F99.description: Research unique cooking methods (e.g., open fire, outdoor oven, underground) and equipment (e.g., tamale steamer, bamboo skimmer, tandoori oven) of various countries.

26FAB00A1AE5496394F9733C5C5ACDFE.description: Investigate foods eaten around the world.

E04F6EC442BB431C93B2C31A60D3E9FB.description: Research dietary needs and nutrition requirements for stages in life including: infants; toddlers; children; teens; adults; pregnant and/or nursing women; senior citizens; people experiencing specific health concerns; and, people experiencing reduced mobility or independence.

F8676F18A14E4AC99166EA123D76CF7C.description: Explore the role of cholesterol in the body’s health.

A9B9FEC09F4247918110667843F8973E.description: Investigate the effects of the consumption of diuretics (e.g., caffeine).

3EC0ED31ED674A019047ECC716152514.description: Examine how candy and chocolate fits into Canada’s Food Guide and a healthy eating pattern (e.g., savouring treats, eating mindfully, choosing smaller portions).

2CA45FB490E24EBD9554156AD72C73A6.description: Inquire into sustainability and social justice implications of cocoa production and marketing.

27FCDF2A01514DBBB44A97B25369791F.description: Explore the diversity of flavours and ingredients in candies and chocolates from various cultures (e.g., chili and chocolate in Mexico, fennel seeds in India, sweet bean curd in China).

5BD5617DA7B34D0B836344C4806C9E36.description: Compare elements (e.g., taste, cost, ingredients) of homemade and commercial chocolates and candies.

F1002392EE874D098AB7234BD26575E8.description: Demonstrate proper use and care of equipment (e.g., molds, candy thermometer).

BD5B99D586874940881F5EACC4FC5518.description: Investigate chocolate preparation techniques (e.g., pour, dip, paint, fill, drizzle).

297670D058D041FFAE748B9D46027E35.description: Explore the types of chocolate (e.g., white, dark, milk, semi-sweet, bittersweet) used in chocolate making.

65BA02E3CC674ABDA77DD88FC76850E1.description: Investigate types of chocolate candies (e.g., solid, filled, bark).

1EEE68447BD04310BC56CC04593FD3EA.description: Demonstrate proper safety techniques when working with hot sugar.

19592780555845B2BC15DA70357E6DD9.description: Experiment with different stages of syrup using the cold water test and/or candy thermometer.

DA6A0A2923DF4FC9A0AC447099472A35.description: Explore the purpose of various ingredients used in candy making (e.g., sugar, syrup, liquids, flavourings).

A7303895C226418DBD0AD16258A8CDD9.description: Investigate the types of candies including: • crystalline (e.g., fudge and fondant); non-crystalline (e.g., taffy, brittle, caramels); fruit leather; candied citrus peels; and, marshmallows.

AA53C1EC72F84095BE728006A846E6BA.description: Discuss the meaning of terminology related to candy and chocolate production (e.g., tempering, soft ball, hard ball, crystallization).

4DDDD82B5E0B45708C7319BF68A0DFC0.description: Examine chemistry needed to create successful candy and chocolate recipes.

0FDC9CD6D0C943F8B061F32FF009F924.description: Explore the history of candy and chocolate making.

37F437BECEB04321A4A67068E8B0AFA6.description: Investigate methods used to make candy and chocolate.

75F909F3D3034AC9AE68A70C4C5D6875.description: Research specialty baking unique to a variety of countries.

6E62909F037B419D98C96716C54D237D.description: Explore types of equipment (e.g., mixers, shaped pans, piping bags) needed to create specialty foods.

3308C15FFEFE41A2BE9E9E1597FB6672.description: Investigate preparation (e.g., handling, stages in production, shaping, preparation techniques, standards for evaluation) of specialty baked products.

67210C1E62DA47CB8478972352100295.description: Discuss the qualities (e.g., unique ingredients, appearance, texture, flavour, preparation methods) of a variety of sweet and savoury specialty foods such as specialty cakes, pastries, tourtières, truffles and advanced yeast breads.

547DC982253A42178C797D77C3A3BB30.description: Inquire into the creation of sweet and savoury specialty foods.

18E7106ABB4345849584D865D4C1385E.description: Plan, prepare and present food, using the components of meal appeal (i.e., colour, texture, flavor, shape, size, temperature) to demonstrate good food presentation.

AA1F13EC6BDD4F859738663A1E80A41F.description: Examine the key elements of food presentation including: colour; shape; texture; arrangement; garnish; and, plating.

B8BFEEE3B39D41E8AE2355B2E5B9983F.description: Explore ways to incorporate healthy or alternative food options to meet a variety of dietary needs.

9B1CDC1186284307A15B84720D99CAA4.description: Explore elements necessary to prepare a large feast to celebrate a special occasion or holiday including: budget; meal planning (e.g., menu, number of guests, diet restrictions, invitations, quantity of food, variety, nutrition, required groceries, recipe selection);  meal preparation (e.g., preparation time, sequence of tasks, food safety, food presentation); meal service (e.g., level of formality, service style, table setting, guest seating); and, work plan (e.g., table preparation, clean up, storage of leftovers).

E376FD2690224B95BB68A023622A400F.description: Inquire into the historical evolution of entertaining with food.

F510D8579D054E9DB884189AFFDEBE02.description: Examine factors (e.g., religion, family traditions, season, party theme, lifestyles) that influence the selection of food and beverages for special occasions.

5955214140714621AC5D90D38A201C9E.description: Discuss foods and beverages associated with various festive occasions (e.g., birthdays, weddings, school events, holiday celebrations).

3360C1A5ACF34316B75EF5DA3B81AD8E.description: Plan and prepare foods for special occasions.

A09C8CEB46D34F0E826ACBED29AC8637.description: Explore how different food environments (e.g., far North, urban, rural, prairie, coastal) in Canada impact the food choices we make (e.g., food deserts, food swamps, regional foods).

48BC4EFC75254FB99CA946A798C3E93B.description: Discuss similarities and differences in food among the regions in Canada

1B9DBB1B4E5D4EC8B1D2B5280ABDC61D.description: Research influences (e.g., seasonal changes, geography, types of vegetation, fish and game) on historical Inuit, Métis and First Nations food choices.
